sourceMeaningMnemonic: Tie a <radical>squid</radical> to a <radical>knife</radical> and you get a <kanji>sword</kanji>! Knives are too small to be considered a sword on their own. That's why you strapped a squid to it. They're the right shape, kinda pointed, so no one will know it's just a knife.
meaningInfo: Imagine creating your own sword out of a knife and a squid.
readingMnemonic: You learned how to make <kanji>sword</kanji>s this way from <reading>Ken</reading> (<ja>けん</ja>) the samurai. He put his own little squid buddy on his knife and now no one realizes it's not a sword!
readingInfo: Picture Ken swinging his squid sword at you. *Squish* it squirts ink on your shoulder. But it doesn't really hurt.
